p: The bioactivity of EOs is the sum of its constituents which act either in a synergistic or in an antagonistic way [ 7, 17]. The term “bioactivity” could be used for all EOs as well as their main active constituents either stable or volatile such as monoterpenes, sesquiterpenoids, benzenoids, and phenylpropanoids which demonstrate a sort of biological activity on humans, animals, and plants.
